Fragment I  ·  Circa 2007 CE  ·  The First Known Work

Various — Uncharted · Flow Records @ Feb. 07

Various — Uncharted

Date of Inscription Feb 11, 2007 14:36
Replies
Views 3,609
IsraTranceDiscogs
Hi All ! The lovely label, Flow, is back to business with new compilation, full of progressive suprises selected by new project called Citizen (side project of Zen Mechanics). "Uncharted" is actually the first release of this label for this year and this info is just make the expections higher. On the track list you can find popular and honorable names like Atmos, James Monro, Perfect Stranger, Freq and more.... So, now it the time to check what is hiding behind those impressive names.
  • 01.Perfect Stranger & Pena - Ode ao sol What is more pleasant for start than collaboration of two pioneers - Yuli & Pena. "Ode ao sol" track is just brilliant, everything is going on slowly and smartly like it should be. The tempo is low but the vibes just going up and up. The brake is very clever - short male vocal, nervous atmosphere and than come the uplifting kick, which load smiles on the listener's face big time. Great opening guys.
  • 02.Citizen - Uncharted The Citizen project (Wouter & Sander) is taking this VA one level up. The track is built well from the first second till the last one. The process is developing gradually like the proggy offical rules . All those happy playings around just make it more pumpy and jumpy. The power factor is still not on maximum, but "Uncharted" track is a big step for that.
  • 03.Atmos - Luxor The groove's master is here !!! the respectable artist is present his latest mateiral called "Luxor". What a pleasure - everything is located on the right place and the unique atmosphere of Atmos is the highlight thing for me. This tune is a hallucinate trip to higher zones with deep diging element. The level of the production is very high with excellent qualiy of sound. No words can describe the beautiful seven and half mins which called "Luxor". The first track-list included 8 track without this one, but I guess it's was a crime to give up on this track.
  • 04.Dick Trevor & James Monro - The big squeeze The experienced Monro unite forces with Mr. Trevor for create this loop. The style here is a bit diffrent than the first tracks, "The big squeeze" tune is deeper with more influences from the electro genre and together the result is amazing. A music with story beyond and remarkable moments. A fine variation for the next to come.
  • 05.Liftshift - Window to the world The fresh comers from Holland, Erik and Claus, is on the stage now. Their track is disappointed me a bit, because the non- creation of ideas and games as I like to hear. The track is groovy and flowing well but something is missing for me, maybe a special melody or powerful brake. Anyway, give your chance for this project and you might like it.
  • 06.Annarchy - Wherever The bigest suprise in this cd is "Wherever" track by the terrific woman - Anna Heifetz from Israel. Annarchy is a promising project, which futured to release many tracks soon, and here she is just bought one more fan. I think it's been a while since this kind of music came out from the holy-land - the kick is fat and heavy, the baseline is chilly but somehow the body is moving without control. The brain is also have a job here and with all this characteristics, we get a marvelous experience. People keep your eyes for this super talented girl.
  • 07.Freq - Awaken (lish RMX) Shay & Lior (LISH) are an appricated project and thats maybe the reason for their choice to take one of Aran's (FREQ) best work and spill their ideas on it. This guys took the Lish typical style, put it on this track and save the unforgetable melodies from the original track...you ask how is the final product ? AMAZING !!! simply a rare track with the most special vibes I heard lately. Way to go Lish for another successful remix, despite the big challenge.
  • 08.Zen Mechanics - Ground Control (Perfect Stranger RMX) I really hope you are all prepare for one of the legendary tracks ever. This remix is definitely the best work on this compilation. It's the same project from the first track, but this time Yuli is alone inside the studio and let all his crazy impulses come out without pity on anyone. With all the respect for Wouter, but this new mix is few levels up - the PS line is fit well to "Ground Control" track. The best moment here for me is the brake, which starts from 03:50 and left me speachless with huge smile on the face and try to understand what the hell was it ?! Thank you Yuli "genious" Fershtat !!!
  • 09.Flowjob - Jessica Lee It's a very hard work to take the control after massive tune like the last one, but you can trust on the Flow-Job guys. "Jessica Lee" is the most suitable track for close such a rare compilation. The tune is followed be female singing and cheezy elements all over the way. Well, how can I sum up this special experience I passed here ? I don't think words are enough for give you a clue about the music here and the only option you have is to get it somehow. Flow Records - I can say surely that this is your BEST release so far, please keep it up. You can get it here : Or here : A MUST CD !!!

Fragment II  ·  Circa 2005 CE

Indoor - Progressive Trance · Avatar Records, Re-release, 2004

Indoor - Progressive Trance

Date of Inscription Jun 15, 2005 20:37
Replies
Views 1,286
IsraTranceDiscogsSpotify
Hi All ! 11 Years after the original album released, I decided to review it (mainly because the re-release of Avatar crew...thumb up!). So, the original album released on 1994 and 10 years later Avatar Records released it again in a special re-mastered version (the re-mastered mady by Avi Algranati him-self). Indoor consist of Avi Algranati (Space Cat), Ofer Dikovski (Oforia) and Marko Goren (Tandu). ' Progressive trance ' is their debut album and that eventually was the only album they ever recorded as Indoor. 1 - Vertigo 07:16 On the first track already, you can understand why this album became one of the important albums on the history & present and future of the trance scene. Special atmosphere with all goa elements...you can feel the efforts that Avi, Ofer and Marko put here...very complicated and intersting...it's the kind of the track you can't stop in the middle, this is a story from the first second till the last one ! 2 - Mad Horizon 07:41 After 40 seconds of undefined playing, enter the first kick..it's so unique that impossible not like it. A lot of developments in this track...everything just be more and more intersting and the melodies...ahh...what can I say ? BEATIFULL !!! it's so hard to find melodies like those on our days... 3 - Amora 06:41 The kick here is faster than the kick on the first two tracks...more 'dancer' and pumping. I tell you it's something amazing...try to play this tune and not move your heads...it just impossible, our body respond automaticly for the tune...excllent work !! 4 - Naxus 09:50 Almost 10 minutes of delightful track ! 2 minutes of slow kick with crazy elements and the melodi that start on 02:13...OMG...amazing !!! So much emotions on one track. I don't know if there are words to describe the feeling I feel whan I hear this track..nothing bad to say about - just PERFECT ! 5 - Sweet Coming Home 07:14 WOW ! what a beatifull begining for amazing track ! relaxing tune and positive with good energy...big smile stretched on my face what this track playing The last two minutes are maybe the most beatifull minutes I've ever heard...freedom feeling...everything good...no worries...just smile and smile !!! 6 - Sid 07:03 After a happy track the things turn to be more serious...deep tune without many melodies. Indoor guys shpw us they know to produce also a diffrent style that their regualr style. If I need to define this track, I'll call it "dark-goa" track. 7 - The Key 08:30 The amaing goa atmosphere back with all the attached factors - intersting story, "goa" melodies and unique atmosphere...OLD IS GOLD ! it's so true... 8 - Camel 08:05 This track I would call trance in progress...I tell you those track are replacement for drugs you turn to be hallucinate without take anything...just focus the music and go with it... 9 - Shiva 09:55 We get to the end already ?! Maybe the most famous tune of this brilliant project and I can understand why... It's the 9 minutes and 55 seconds that I had the best time in my entire life The first five minutes are amazing and special But the last five minutes it's the mintues I won't forget ever - just close your eyes and let the track lead you to unknown place...what more can I say...you must hear it (when you read the last lines make sure you get this album just for this minutes...un-forgetable minutes !!). To sum it up, listeing for this album it's emotionaly experience. This album is one of the best album I remmeber, no doubt about it. If I could ask one wish, I think I ask for more Indoor track but it won't happen... I want to thank Avatar Records for gave me the opportunity to take part on this experience..THANK YOU !!! If there is one album that I can recommend without any doubut, is this one... GET IT
  • 01.Vertigo
  • 02.Mad Horizon
  • 03.Amora
  • 04.Naxus
  • 05.Sweet Coming Home
  • 06.Sid
  • 07.The Key
  • 08.Camel
  • 09.Shiva

Fragment III  ·  Circa 2005 CE

Sandman - Witchcraft · Avatar-Records

Sandman - Witchcraft

Date of Inscription Apr 20, 2005 18:26
Replies
Views 3,958
IsraTranceDiscogsSpotify
Hi All ! This time I choose to review Sandman's 'Witchcraft' . When this album released in the first time, I didn't know what trance is so when I saw Avatar releases it again, I immediately sit and hear it from the first second till the last second 1 - Perfect Stranger This classic album start with undefined style, a lot of elemnts together and the bpm go up and down...in this track I start to realize what Izki Levi did for get such a respect as he get today...but it's just the start. 2 - Flight Or Fight Now the direction is clear - GOA ! the thing I like in Izik's trac is that you never hear the kick alone...always there is cool effect or element escorted and it's made the track very special...this one is example for it ! 3 - Turtle Beach 10 minutes and 25 second of chaos ! I feel high when I hear this track and there are no limits all you need to do is to concentrate in the track and I promise your body will move without you do anything...it's a magic ! 4 - Ghostrider (Time Tunnel RMX) There are not much words to decribe this tune just get in the track and forget everything. 5 - Shockwave The name here play a role because shockwave it's excatly what you feel when you hearing this tune...goa atmosphere all over and classic melodies that make your considerations mix up in your head 6 - Nostradamus (The Prophecy RMX) Dim atmosphere here...something unclear...very complicated, this is not track you can "digest" in the first time you hear it. 7 - Bad News (New Way) In this track you can hear some strange melodies that goa is the first word you think in the same second yoyu hear those melodies...the atmosphere is sad a bit here like something bad happen (maybe I little exaggerate ). 8 - Mushroom Symphony Tell you the truth...I heard this track few times continuity and I didn't find words to describe it (again ). 9 - Faith This track didn't release in the original album and it's release here as bonous track. You can hear the diffrences between this one and the other tracks in the albums...the bass line here is more to the dance floor and the effects reminds me some effects of the present time like the vocal in the end. All in all, it was nice experiment and this album help me understand how much efforts and emotions the artists putted in their track (there are also artists that still do it but not many ). I want to thank Avatar-Records for this re-release, it's give me a chance to fill some thing that I missed...THANKS !
  • 01.Perfect Stranger
  • 02.Flight Or Fight
  • 03.Turtle Beach
  • 04.Ghostrider (Time Tunnel Remix)
  • 05.Shockwave
  • 06.Nostradamus (The Prophecy Remix)
  • 07.Bad News (New Way)
  • 08.Mushroom Symphony

Various — Pure Imagination Vol 2 · Utopia-Records

Various — Pure Imagination Vol 2

Date of Inscription Mar 28, 2005 16:39
Replies

IsraTranceDiscogs
Hi All ! The second part of 'Pure Imagination' package of Utopia-Records release now ! the man who compiled this compilaion is Benny Damski a.k.a SIXSENSE 1) Freaked Frequency - 51 Times (145 BPM) Tell you the truth- I never heard about this project and I assume it's just another project, but opposite is correct- this is awesome project with full energy music with melodies and a lot of power, a very pumping tune that can bomb dance-floors. We will see another track by this project few tracks down 2) Sixsense - The Hive (147 BPM) Benny with very special tune. The track start with male vocal and than get in a fat bass line. Not many games in this one, just hear and dance. The brake in 5:30 is so emotinally and powerfull, that no-one can hold him-slef any more. 3) Ananda Shake - Intensity (146 BPM) After their debut ans successful album, Lior and Osher continue to produce high quality tracks with their unique style - many games in the bass line and beatifull melody in the middle of the track. I like their works ! 4) Vibe Tribe - Thriller (146 BPM) Another talented project from Utopia family. Stas & Elmar with little diffrent tune here- more emotions and a lot effects, but the kick is the same kick of Vibe Tribe ! Happy tune with a lot of positive energies. 5) Freaked Frequency - Panic (145 BPM) We back to this project like I promised now we can hear a serious blaster tune with many vocals and nice guitars. The groove here is very good and the track built in excllent way till the guitars got in and that it's impossible to stop the madness. 6) Sixsense - Fight (148 BPM) I don't know why but this tune remind me the Chemical-Crew style- a lot of power, fast tempo and many effects, guitars and all this made this tune to a powerfull one without mercy. Benny get crazy KARAHANA 7) Aniki - Ayawaska Vamos (148 BPM) Aniki is Yan Azulai from the project- Nissimyani. On his side project, Ben creates a morning full-on with a lot of feelings and deep emotions. I don't have many words to decribe this tune, all you need is hear it and enjpy 8) Life Exstension - Aaliyah (145 BPM) Another new project (at least for me). A full-on track with nice bass line, this one in more relax that the others and I get good feeling when I heard it. 9) Chemical Drive - Gshock (143 BPM) Ronen Sahar with a slow tune with unique style. Perfect track for closing crazy compilation- nice melodies and slow bass line. I hope you like it too...review it

Utopia Records release very quality compliation ! every track has his magic. This compilation include 9 full on tracks that the most of them made by Utopia crew.
  • 01.Audiotec - Tantra : Miki with exelent track that show us what bombs we gonna hear on his debut album. Very emotionaly track and fast bass-line with Audiotec special melodies...very good track for opening this compilation.
  • 02.Ultravoice - Psyde : As a continoue to his album , Avi , release here another amazing track ! this is more to the dance floor with beatifull melodies and some games with the bpm...good work Ultravoice !
  • 03.Perplex - Culture : The compilation continoue with Ronen's track. U can hear Perplex style and power on this track , this is one of my favorites track on this compilation.
  • 04.Sixsense - Tropical Magic : Benny with powerfull tune ! I think it is the best tune of him so far. Like the name , on the track there is Tropical atmosphere and this is give something special to the track. Good bass line and happy melodies. Keep it up Benny , you are talent producer !
  • 05.Vibe Tribe - Albert Balbert : There is reason why this track is on the middle of the compilation...so much power on this track and the melodies are just great. This track can bomb any dance floor. Without doubt I can say that this track is the best track of Vibe Tribe that released ( for me , of course ). I also like the name . This is the best track on this compilation for me and one of the best tracks that I heard on the last years !
  • 06.Silent Scream - Twister : WOW ! Yogev Abutbul & Ban Elkayam from Beer-Sheva , they are the guys behind this exellnt project - Silent Scream. What a track .... the bass-line is exactly what I love and the melodies...what can I say...everyone that heard the melodies of this track can't forget it hour after. It is sure that good future expect to this young guys , and I hope they bomb all the dance floors in the world and of course it is one of my favorite track on the comp.
  • 07.Ananda Shake - Dream Drop : Groovy tune , that can build set perfectly. This project is known by the quality tracks that his make and I enjoy from every singel track by them.
  • 08.Elec3 & Toxictoy - New Possibilities : I don't know much about this projects , but after I heard this tune u can be sure that I am one of them fans Seems like it is very successful combination. Very powerfull tune with big power ! Elec3 and Toxictoy keep it up , I am with you
  • 09.Chemical Drive - Pause : The track that closed this amazing compilation. This is special tune with less power than the others but still can bomb dance floors. I very intersing to hear more music by this project , it is must be something good ! Ok , thats my comments for the tracks... Again , it is very good compilation , for sure one of the best full on compilation that released ever. Rating : 9.5 \ 10 ( so close to be perfect... ) Now u can comments ppl , I want to know what u think about this compilation.

This is the first release that I heard from Sirius - Records and it is so great ! ! ! Omi ( 40% ) collected 9 amazing trax and get them into one killa compilation. This comp include tracks by the big & upcoming names of the trance scence , like : Dali , Paranormal Atack , RinkDink , Exaile and more . . . 1.Rocky and Intelabeam- My mind - Great opening for the compilation ! exellnt combination between this 2 artists , I really look for more tuns from them. 2.Illumination-Armadildo - Here the madness start . . . Amir with his best tune so far ( without Xerox I mean ) and it is fuc*ing good ! fast base line and crazy atmoshpere ! Keep it up Illumination. 3.Dali- Love of my life - This is the suprise of the compilation ! This girl just produce amazing track , full of guitars and beatifull vocals by Dali her self . 4.40% - Shut up - Omi with powerfull tune ! this 1 make ppl digging on the dance floor without merci. 5.Paranormal Attack- Go on - The craziest track in this cd ! the track opened with vocal " Every body goes on , everybody steal your brain " , all the track full of games , guitars and effects. Total madness on this one , it is my favorite ! 6.Exaile - Pure - Exaile power strike again ! I can't stay sit down when I hear this track , nice melodies and so much P - O - W - E - R !!! 7.40% vs. Paranormal Attack - Babas fritos -I don't know how to desribe this one . . . U need to take 2 crazy artists , sit them on one studio and this is the result : incrediblle track with some special magic that I can't explain. Very good one ! 8.40% vs. Paul taylor vs. Joti aka Psychaos-Schwarmagedon - Little diffrent from the others , but still , if it is on this compilation so it must be crazy 9.Rinkadink & Mike modular- Just for kicks - I love the name the name exaplain what we should look for on the track . . . diffrent kicks all around the track , sometimes fast sometimes bit slow , nice way for closing fantastic compilation ! All in all , this is one of the best compilation I ever heard ( the craziest one for sure ) and I can't wait to more compilation like this 1 . So ppl don't wait anymore , run to the store and buy it , I promise u dont sorry about it ! Favorites : 1 !! , 3 !! , 5 !!!! , 6 !!! , 7 !!!! , 8 !! Rating : 9 10

IsraTranceDiscogsSpotify
The first compilation by this great label ! Hi All ! After almost two month from the release date of this compilation, I decided to write a review for share with you what I think about this comp. This is the second part of Mindcontrollers series, which compiled by Nomad and Talamasca.
  • 01.Talamasca - Overload The track is start with very short vocal and 3 seconds later, came the powerful kick of Cedrec. I must say that this is mayB my favorite tune from Talamasca ever, when I hear it, I can understand why Cedric is so admired on the trance scene. Overload has excllent building, you can hear the goa influences with the fast kick and the deep melodies all over. What an amazing begining to this compilation - HIGHLY RECOMMENDED !
  • 02.Nomad - Tribute with no name The second track is belongs to Nomad, his style just rock ! pumping baseline with those beautiful melodies is someting really special. This what I call - pure psytrance !
  • 03.Shagma - Piano Bar This tune is more deep and less "happy" than the first two tracks. It's an intersting tune from this new project which include "tough" baseline, "flat" kick and some nice melodies in. I'm sure we'll hear more suprises from this project in the future.
  • 04.Enterpise - NLO A pure morning tune with all the necessary elements : friendly baseline, fat kick, a lot of cool effects, some games with the baseline and of course - happy melodi ! It's a pleasant tune for any hour of the day.
  • 05.Dizzy Mind & Nazuk - Psychosis Tell you the truth - I don't really know this 2 projects but the first minute and half make me jump to the sky - beautiful playing with a pumping kick after. The baseline is so groovy and it accompanied by very nice effects and vocals. I'm almost sure this tune will blast the dance-floor...be careful !
  • 06.Talamasca and Polaris - Fantastic plausibility A french co-operation with full power ! I really like this track because it has something special on it, I don't know how to explain it. I cal feel the deep emotions and feelings which Cedric and Polaris put here.
  • 07.220 V - Damage procedure Crazy track, full of suprises...nothing is expected. The baseline is "flexible" and has a lot of games and changes. This tune really remind me Junya's (Eskimo) style, which is always good thing. 220 V - keep it up and up !
  • 08.Phanatic & Electro Sun - Possessed Mind It's one of the best track on this compilation ! a serious dance floor bomb ! The begining of the track is so pumping that I almost make a hole in the celling and it's impossible not talk about this amazing melodi...WOW...it really a special one. Nadav and Kfir keep blast like this one, we all want it !
  • 09.Rumble Pack - The sliph What is better than close this excllent compilation with Rumble Pack's tune ? nothing A groovy tune with fast kick which force you to move your body like a crazy. It can easily jump the dance floor, just play it. The brake on 05:00 is brilliant - moledies, vocals and madnessssssssssss ! People, you don't want to miss it !!!

When the brake over in 05:48 the dance-floor destroyed. 4-Point Black We get to the title track. All in all, if you like progressive (also if you don't like), you must hear this album, perfect progressive that enjoyable to hear on every second in the day. Flow Records, you really rocked with this release, Yoni and Tomer could not choise better label for release their debut album. I want to thank to all the ppl that take part in this excllent release. It's a massive track with excellent sound and kicking baseline. When you say the word "powerful" , this is the kind of tunes you think about. On 04:00 they decided to push up more and we get awesome brake with power, power and more power...dance floor bomb !
  • 03.Cop Thing 145 BPM This tune is different a bit...the kick is more groovy & stretched and it's perfect for shake the body. I think that the target of this tune is to down after the last bomb and prepare our body to the next bomb...but still stay on the right atmosphere.
  • 04.Nead for lead 145 BPM Before the comments I want to say thumb up to Gidi for the name - it's easy and catchy. Now for the track, powerful tune with full-on baseline and some cool effects in the middle. Also you can hear a really short melodi, but the line is clear - 100% dance floor.
  • 05.Rebellion 138 BPM Down-tempo-full on track slow baseline with Gidi's kick and some male vocals which repeat several times. This is not a track to crazy with, it's more to dance slowly and easily...enjoylable tune !
  • 06.On the edge 145 BPM Now Gidi's target is to get till the edge of your powers. A massive track with some nice baseline games and well building. The last brake (04:15) is more melodical and emotionaly, even you can hear some guitar in...and in the end everything exploding !
  • 07.Awaken 145 BPM If someone is tired or something, now its the time to awake stright to the dance floor. Gidi's style is so unique and special, so every tune sound similar ("same same but different") and thats why you never know what to expect from him. I really like this one because it so energetic and melodical, without compromises.
  • 08.Kiss the sound 144 BPM The title track is already here. I expected to hear a dance floor bomb, but Gidi suprised me with some brilliant full on track, with pumping kick and and a lot of fun elements involve.
  • 09.X-Per-Minute 145 BPM This tune remind me Gidi's old style - deep, dark and powerful. Six fast minutes...it's sound much more fast than 145 BPM (thats the reason for the name I think)...hallucinatory track ! it's a refrehing change for the album.
  • 10.Skylines Rmx 144 BPM Gidi's took the track to the direction he want, and the result is excellent ! more melodies, more Gidi Well done !!!

  • 06.On the edge 145 BPM After the last bomb, Psycraft keeps with their concept - burn the dance floor. It's kind of tracks which jump any crowd and make them fly...excellent full-on track with all necessary elements - vocals, fast baseline , danceable kick and even some nice melodi inside.

Date of Inscription Jan 3, 2006 12:21

IsraTranceDiscogs
Hi All ! A brand new compilation, it called " Globalize ". This compilation compiled by Yotopia (Tomer Dayan & Yontan Rimon), just few months after they released their debut album ("Point Blank") also on Flow-Records. "Globalize" present 9 down-tempo progressive tracks which selected carefully by the groove masters.
  • 01.Yotopia - bubbles 128 BPM Yoni and Tomer decided start this comp. with their new tune - Bubbles. This one is more like Yotopia last releases - good groove, fat kick and slow baseline. Bubbles can be used an excellent building for 135 BPM progressive set because it has the secret formula - how to make you move your body without ask it. Also some nice relaxing melodi is playing in the middle.
  • 02.Flash Brothers-past will be future (D-Nox & Beckers remix) 130 BPM I must say that every tune by this project give me happy feeling because they have something fun and positive on their materials. This remix combine some nice vocals, good flow and cool melodies together. When you listen to this tune, you can easily move the head with big smile on the face.
  • 03.Ace Ventura - go with da flow 130 BPM Now we get to the sweetest suprise of 2005 (on the progressive genre) - Yoni Oshrat. After few years of producing a full-on music, Yoni decided to do some changes and start to produce amazing progressive music under the name "Ace Ventura". Here he prove again why his music is so good and lovely - perfect sound work, excellent building and of course...groove, groove ans more groove . The last brake is so pumping and danceable that even on 130 BPM people can get crazy on. Great work Yoni and keep it up (can't wait for the album).
  • 04.B.L.T & Morax - implant (Perfect Stranger rmx) 135 BPM The stranger, Yuli Fershtat, decided he want to re-mix his own tune (together with Morax) and he did it so good. I just love the way Yuli get in his powerful kick and make everyone jump higher and higher. Yuli is very experienced so he know what the crowd want and he give it to them
  • 05.Liquid Soul - transmission 135 BPM This is another new artist (for me) which discovered just on 2005. Capo's music attracted me immediately. Here he just keep the high level and show me he can groove the dance floor also on 135 BPM. This track is the best on this compilation (IMHO)...special atmosphere all over together with crazy effects ( really like the up-down on 06:25) and of course delightful melodies.
  • 06.Ryan Halifax - opposites 130 BPM This tune is different a bit from the last tracks, European progressive style which focus on the progress side. It is very easy and comfortable for connect to...this what I called "pure progressive" - way to go Ryan Halifax !
  • 07.Antix - tame the Beast 130 BPM Antix style is so unique and special so from the first kick I recognized his line. This tune is more for bars & beaches and less for parties, almost no brakes just slow and safe flow. All you need to do is listen and enjoy from well-build progressive track. The first brake start on 04:00 and here Antix show some emotions with an intersting melodi, after one minute and 30 seconds the slow baseline back but now with more "noise" .
  • 08.Spanner - pagan pulse 130 BPM Spanner isn't waste even one second and kicked from the first second . "Pagan Pulse" is accompanied by vocals all over the track and very nice effects. I see it more clubby. Anyway, this artist need to get a compliments for his variation here.
  • 09.Gaudium - sonic substance 134 BPM Another project which released his debut album (Nordic Nature) on 2005. Now they get the honor to close this wonderfull compilation and they do their job respectly. It kind of the tunes you must flow with for discover the story behind...this project has some psychedelic elements on his materials and thats what make it so intersting and mysterious. This compilation is a MUST on every cd-player around the world !!!

  • 10.Brain Damage ¢ Flux 140 BPM Awesome ending for this compilation...Ido could not choose better track for close the compilation with.   • 07.Tsabeat Vs Optical Human - CDx4 Elad & Eran were try to produce something different and they did it good, actually. Here you can find more groove, less madness and a proffesional building. Although, I think this one will not make people going crazy but still it’s a special one.

  • 09.Static Nation - Mechanic Dream Fat kick, slow baseline and some good melodies, this the story behind this track. I don't see my self dig deep from this track but the brain defently work here for figure out the meaning of this one.

Hi All ! Hannes Sync . The album called Editmode and present nine progressive tracks with a lot of groove and freshing beats.

I found my self moving the body very slowly and let the track lead me wherever it want. The comibination of emotionaly melodi together with slowly baseline is creating a nervous atmosphere, which turn to be a bit annoying near the end of the track.
  • 02.Loxan The second track is a completly different story. It's start with a morning melody with some developments, which keep me down untill the kick's enterace. Progressive full of happiness and smiles all over. The melodies are always around, never disappear...this kind of progressive was the main reason for me to be a prog-fan.
  • 03.Waveview Also here the vibe of the track is very warimng and positive. The kick is very groovy and go hand by hand with an avarage baseline. I think that this one won't do his job on the dance floor, but definitely shake some asses on home-listening. The track is turn to be a boring track because the same loop is back too many times.
  • 04.Multistage 53 second of introduction is enough for me ohh this fat kick always remind me a good memories...groove all the way. Again, I don't think I would dig to this track, but it's an enjoyable one for sure. The track is going down sometimes and going up again without any special brake or somethingjust up & down again and again. The brake on 04:35 is somehow make me jump with the kick's comeback but not for long time.
  • 05.Editmode The title track is always the most anticipated track for me. This time I disappointed a bit, because in my opinion the required power is missing and the track is just "nice" and not "powerfull". I like the flow of this track, which keep me always intersting and not boring. Although, the track has not the unique magic and thats why it's sound too similar to the other tracks.
  • 06.Erase This track is between the limit of progressive and full on. This melody is sound so good and it's take the track to the deep side. Avarage progressive music with a beautiful melodies around. The brake on 03:10 is give a new life to the track but few minutes later is back to be the same like before. The highlight moment of the track is on 05:00 - after few seconds of quite and soft melody, the track is going up gradually but nothing too special is happen.
  • 07.Kicka Finally you can hear kind of variety on the track. The baseline is harder and it's seems like a more serious tune on compare to the other tracks...also the less-melodies is keep the track more mature and proffesional. On 03:00 there is a spark of melody, which follow the track softly. I call it "active-progressive". Very nice track here !
  • 08.53er I did not connect to this track at all..too boring and exhausting. Even tough there is some nice melodies and good vibe. In my opinion, with a slower baseline it could be a better track...down tempo progressive i mean.
  • 09.Entar Last bur for sure not least is "Entar". Finnaly you can find some ceartivity and new ideas like it should be, too bad it the end already. One of my favorites from all album...slowly and high quality...keep this direction Hannes.

  • 01.Quantum Mechanics (140 bpm) Tamir and Yair are opened their album with a slowly full on track (on compare to the avarage full on style tempo). The kick here is fat and soft with a rolling baseline, which creates a sensitive vibe. I think the traget of this track is to open the album like a set's opening, it's means - a slow building for a strength diging. It is a good full on track for start moving the legs.
  • 02.Fatality (Vs. Fatali) (141 bpm) Now the Atomic Pulse guys unites with the most emotional artist on the full on scene Eitan Fatali. You can feel it already from the begining with a delicate opeining-melody and one minute later arrives a bouncing kick. The Fatali's touch is very sensible here, which is totally positive thing. On 03:25 there is a down in the track with purpose to go up with a rhythm melody which make me smile and move the head. This is definitely a good combination.
  • 03.Single Cell (142 bpm) As you can see the tempo is going up gradually as the album progressing. Now I can officaly write about this track - "a dance floor material". The kick here is more pumping and jumping with a faster baseline and some nice effects around. On 02:30 there is a brake with a male sample and a very danceable rise. The most important thing here is that the track is always alive and not stuck with one direction all along. Later, there is a beautiful melody which add a lot of positive feeling to the listener but the up is not powerfull enough in my opinion.
  • 04.Amino Acid (Vs. Cyrus The Virus) (143 bpm) One more cooperation is with the Spun's project - Cyrus The Virus. The begining is very nice with a calm playing but after 50 second enter in a suprising kick which fling everyone. Generaly, the track is kind of boring on many parts but it's gets some highlights moments like on 03:30 with a special games and a bombastic up.
  • 05.Direct Source (145 bpm) The middle track is the title track. The tempo is avarage here. The start of this track is very absorbing untill the first kick gets in. I don't think this track has the power to create a madness on the dance floor, but it's sure can shake some asses over. Maybe more suprises and unexpected elements would take this track to higher levels. Only, on the main brake the track is gets a new life and kicking the crowd to the air.
  • 06.Alternative Reality (145 bpm) When I hear this one I say to my self - "why they did not put more power here? ". This is definitely not a bad track but it's not so powerful as I expected it to be...too calm for me. This kind of tracks won't stay in my memory for long time and it is pity because there is a potential. If you are wonder what kind of track is it, so the answer is - a regular full on track by the regular full on's formula.
  • 07.Noise Freak - 2006 Audio version (145 bpm) The original version was a huge hit on many dance floors around the world. The new upgrade version is start with the so familiar vocal and the amazing melody...the atmosphere here is so happy and comfortable. This version is more mature with a smart build untill the explosion on 04:52. Well done Tamir & Yair.
  • 08.Kuromatic (Featuring DJ Ta-Ka) (143 bpm) One more combination here, and this time with the Japanisee artist - Ta-Ka. An enjoyable full on track with the right elements and an excellent vibe all over the track. For me, this track is one level up from most of the tracks in this album.
  • 09.Mateluna (145 bpm) It is hard to desribe this track because it's too similar to the other tracks here but still has the exclusive touch. Acatully, this one is more powerfull and intersting with some nice groovy beats.
  • 10.Fire Dance RMX (147 bpm) The last track is the remix for the 90's hit - Fire Dance. This one is the fastest track here which is a rare thing on the closing track. After one minute and 40 second of introduction, the Atomic's kick take control and integrate some elements from the original song with the AP's touch. Great re-mix !

Future Prophecy - Body Shaker

Date of Inscription Mar 27, 2006 12:58

IsraTranceDiscogsSpotify
Hi All ! BNE is working very hard nowadays - after the previous release (Atomic Pulse's album), BNE is present the brand new album of Haggai Elazare aka Future Prophecy Body Shaker . The last album of Haggai (Concept Of Love) was opened a new doors with an unique music, this new album just keep the developing and present 10 varied tracks with many influences and creativity.
  • 01.Body Shaker 143 BPM The introduction is un-clear with some happy effects, and from no where enter a short male vocal which actually start the track. Haggai's music is full of vocals & samples and here he combine this with his special and different kick. This track really has the ability to shake the body well because it's include all the required factors - beautifull melodies, a lot of cool vocals and pumping groove. This album couldn't start better...
  • 02.Run Out System 145 BPM Now the atmosphere is more similar to the dance floor's usual atmosphere - the kick is faster and danceable with supporting stretch baseline. This track has a highlights moments like on 03:00 when the kick is going together with the singing perfectly, but on the other hand there is some boring moments of running baseline without any direction. On 04:30 start an emotionaly brake with a powerfull up like it should be...a lot of good playings together which creates a positive harmony.
  • 03.Rock The Show 145 BPM I really like the beginging here, it's make you get to the right mood. This track is remind me Haggai's old music from the last album which is completely good thing. I don't know how to define this kind of music but it's just sound good to the ear and thats the most inportant factor for me. You can hear here some nice guitars with a cool female singing and a good vibe all around. On 03:05 the brake is lead the track to some old & mysterious places with an amzing flute's playing, but don't worry it going up and back to the regulat "noisey" line and add one more effect - the flute an enjoyable track for sure.
  • 04.Sound Like A Melody 145 BPM The melody here remind me the old melodies of Future Prophecy like Indra...ohhh thats so good. The main issue here is the beautiful melody of course but it's going together with a robotic vocals and electronic guitar's playing. It is so speical whats going on here...music with no rules of regular formula just a good flow all over.
  • 05.November Rain 145 BPM I don't really sure what to write about this track, but lets try . Haggai is produced here a "track" with a lot of influnces and ideas like the kind of hip-hop singing on 02:55 and later this singing repeat but with a women emotionaly voice. I did not really connect to this track but it worth a listening for sure.
  • 06.Unisex 145 BPM Finally a track with more attention to the producing it self and less attention to the vocals, smaples and all around that. The atmosphere here is really positive and refreshing. Haggai is actually show here that he can jump the dance floor if he want to.
  • 07.Keep On Rocking 145 BPM The beginging is a developing melody which get the kick's support after one minute. The pumping base line together with the very cool vocal here make me move the head & lips together with the tempo. This kind of music is not so simple to describe, so you must hear it aand understand what it's all about (and you have my recommendation for it ).
  • 08.Syncopa 145 BPM The variation of Haggai's track is just amazing. It's very easy to connect this track and flow with it. The vocals turn this track to be more emotionaly and deep. This track will make you smile for sure .
  • 09.Gabriel 145 BPM For me this one is the best from whole album...really nice game between the vocals and the kick & baseline. The first part of the track is refreshing, which shake a lot of asses over many dance floors for sure. On 02:12 there is a beautifull playing which creates a memorable moment - just close your eyes and let the music lead you to magical place...
  • 10.Rashid 95 BPM The album is close with kind of exciting pray...Sagic Cohen did an excellent job here with the very emotional singing - perfect !! All in all, this album is very special and definitely not something we hear frequently. Another important thing is the lyrices - you can find the all lyrices in the inside booklet. Get it original people

Hi All ! The compilation Patchuli Sexy Lounge is a result of collaboration between MoonStone Records & the Patchuli Bar. Efrat Livne aka Dj F-Rat is the DJane who compiled this cd. The style of this release is a "world-music" with many influences from all genres. All track are fit well to the atmosphere of bars/lounges because the comfortable vibe and the intersting stories behind. The cd is include some tracks of young & talented artists like Mike A , Digital Samsara, Plan B and more...together with that, there is some new version of an experienced artists like Gayo 2005 remake and Children Of The Earth (amabient version). The direction of the Patchuli comp. is clear - present an unique track which sound good on every time at the day on every kind of mood. Actually, it's eleven track on gradual building with a lot of colours and styles. This cd is really a nice experience of 71 minutes with up's & down's, but always keep you fascinated to the music. Recommended for home-listening and maybe for long drive Track List

Oforia - Inner Twist · BNE / Yoyo , May 06

Oforia - Inner Twist

Date of Inscription Jun 6, 2006 13:25
Replies
Views 1,270
IsraTranceDiscogsSpotify
Hi All ! Ofer Dikovsky aka Oforia is release a new album, which called "Inner Twist". The style of this album is a modern full on with a lot of games and satisfication like all Ofer's music. The album was released on BNE Records on May 2006.
  • 01.Heaven On Earth This track is start with the typical effects of Oforia and after 40 seconds all the story is begin. "Heaven On Earth" is a smart start for the album, because here the power is still not on maximum, but the regular magic of Ofer's music is still inside. I don't think this track can cause a serious digging on the dance floor, even though it's can be a nice building for a good full on set. The reason I like Oforia's music is situated on 03:55 - this kind of brakes are so genious...just listen and jump with all those playings all over.
  • 02.Adrenalin (Vs Onyx) "Adrenalin...Adreanalin...Adrenalin..BOOOOM" . This track is a bit boring and stuck...I can't see the crowd say WOW when this track is playing background. There is no harmony or speical atmosphere at all...just a kick & baseline with support of lame effects sometimes, sorry but me personally did not like this track.
  • 03.Spiders "Spiders" is one of the most pumping full on tracks I heard lately...the crazy groove with those happy melodies, which always put smile on the listerner face are just doing the work well. When an artist use on guitars sample, he must do it right & smartly and here Ofer is do it perfect ! this guitars are simply take the track to higher levels. Maybe it's just me but the melody on 04:00 is remind me the old (and good) days of Oforia. My favorite part on this album is the part on 05:00...this morning-melody is sooooo beautiful !!! I can see the sun behind...and together with the kick the combination is just excellent.
  • 04.Return Of The Machines (Feat. B-Wicked) Before I start to write comments about the track, I must mention the fact that B-Wicked is one of my favorites projects because his creativity and the colorful on his music. Here B-Wicked is unite with Mr. Dikovsky and the result can't disappoint. An energetic track all over the way - the power of Oforia together with the amazing ideas of Bertin is a perfect combination. This funky singing is exactly on the right place and give a serious push to the whole track..."Probably go insane..." !! this games with the voclas just make this track unique and powerfull.
  • 05.Show No Mercy (Vs Time Lock) I don't know why, but I can't connect to this track...it's starts good but I tired very fast from this track...maybe this is because the cheezy melodies or the same loop again and again. Anyway, don't judge by my thoughts, listen and check what you think.
  • 06.Art Beats Ofer is give me a compensation after the last track . The name of the track is just symbolize the music it self. From the begining, Ofer is playing games with the beats and do it proffesionaly, on the most artistic way. Those games back again and again, and always varied and different. On 05:05 the brake is start and include the nice beats-games, but this time together with an emotionaly melody, which make me throw my hands everywhere in the room .
  • 07.Unusual Game This track is a good tool for the dacne-floor. It's start with a simple introduction and growing to a smasher track, which has the powers to rock any crowd. All the required elements are inside - the female mysterious vocal, the positive playings, the pupmping-Oforia's kick and the special atmosphere.
  • 08.Inner Twist The tittle track is more softer and deeper. Defenitly one of the best tracks by Oforia so far. The track is built well - on gradually it's going up and developing untill the last part (on 04:00), and there everything explode...how the hell he write all this brilliant melodies ?! great great track !!
  • 09.Dragon Ball Maybe you look for a down-tempo track for the finalla, but Ofer is not. A 145 bpm track with all the necessary power - a full on madness. Oforia is an experienced artist, so you can trust him that he know how to close a good celebrate. The style of the track is so happy and smily, which make the dance so fun and enjoyable...good work by the master !

IsraTranceDiscogsSpotify
Hi All ! Abomination (Eyal & Saar) are releasing their debut album - "Enemy Within". The album released on May in Nexus Media Records. Now it's time to write some words about the music it-self
  • 01.Fallen If you thought about calm opening, you WRONG ! "Fallen" is a pure stomper without any compromise. It's start with a mysterious playing which give a tiny clue about what going to be soon...after exactly one minute the madness is start - a fat kick with a kicking baseline and a lot of hallucinate elements around. A completly dance floor burner.
  • 02.Pass Away (Vs New Dawn Corp.) The next track is "Pass Away". Everything is just sitting perfect here - the introduction is very nice and this baseline can cause a heart-attack for people with weak heart . From this point, nothing is expected...there are always suprises and developments like the guitars from no-where and up's & down's suddenly. A powerfull track !!
  • 03.The Hunt "The Hunt" is start with unclear sample and slowly get together with a bombastic kick, which send the crowd to different galaxy. Eyal @ Saar's style is so danceable for me, they don't make it soft nad pleasent, just the opposite - intransigent and hard. On 03:30 there is a story melody which go hand by hand with the baseline & kick but not for long because the madness in the dance floor must go on on 05:10 the main brake is start 50 seconds later, it's going up with a new power. People be carefull the hunt is looking for you !
  • 04.Mr Nice This time there is no intro - 7 minutes & 13 seconds of total chaos ! the track's name is "Mr Nice" and it's more comfortable indeed (on compare to the first track of course). This complicated effects can be easily a serious hallucination for any brain . Don't try this materisals at home .
  • 05.Amerca's First This one is a bit different than the first four tracks...there is more attention here to the melodies and the emotional side of the track. This track is a must, after all the bombs before and it's give kind of rest to the body (but not for the brain ). The vocal on the begining of the track is very cool and all the melodies inside the track, turn it to be more softer and deeper. On 04:20 the hallucinte playing for the begining in back on the middle brake and give a colorful view. Good work here guys.
  • 06.Enemy I like the introductions of this guys, they just do it right in my opinion and the begining is a very important part of the track. The first minute is very confusing, you expect for a relaxing track, but on 1:25 the issue became more serious and strict and the track is look completly different from this point. "Enemy" track is have the powers to take every listener to un-forgettable trip, full of colors and hallucinations. Trust me, you don't wanna be the enemy of the Abomination guys.
  • 07.Protocol "Protocol" track is more closer to the Israeli full-on nowadays. The kick is smooth and less harder and all the tempo of the track is not so danceable like before. I don't so like this kind of tracks because there is not any energy or something special for make the crowd move his legs. Myabe this track is vreated just for the protocol .
  • 08.Glitch The track is start with a beautiful symphony and developed to be a groovy track. I can feel the atmosphere of the end and thats why (I guess) Eyal and Saar produced something more varied and open minded but thats just the first part of the track. The second part 9which start on 03:10) is back to the karahana of the first tracks and kick us to the sky again. The last theree minutes of the track is a bit boring for me.
  • 09.Deviden (Album Version) "Deviden" is start like a freestyle/down-tempo track, which almost every album close with, BUT (again) the Abomination guys are not like everyone . This is a good choise for close this album with a taste for more. You can hear here the creativeity of this talented guys and this make my head move automaticlly.

Hi All ! The promising label - Mushy Records - is release second release. "Monkey Mission" is compiled by Itay Amaoyal aka In-Panic and include 10 tracks of mostly unfamiliar names together with a rising talents like Bubble project.
  • 01.In-Panic – Access denied Itay him self he is the one who open this comp. A powerfull track with tons of energy...full on for the dance floor. Itay's has something hallucinate in his materials, he know how to put all those effects together perfectly. After 2 and half minutes, there is a rising electronic-guitar which take the track to higher levels of power. It is definitely an intersting track with many developments...my favorite part here is the amazing melody on 05:10 with so much emotions and feelings and few seconds later the guitar come back and the madness is take control...beautifull !!
  • 02.Borderline - After Shock This time Itay unite forces with Amir Gelman under the name "Borderline". Their track is keep the "noisy" direction of the last track but with more style . A groovy baseline together with very fat kick and high level of sound, turn this track to be proffsional and mature. Here also, always something happen - many melodies and up & downs. Again, I must pay your attention to the brilliant melody on 04:30...simply an art !
  • 03.In-Panic vs Bubble - Imitation of life Thw two leading projects of Mushy Records teamed together on the 3rd track of this special compilation. The unique touch of Bubble dou (GUY & Karen) is very sensed here. You can find a soft melodies followed by inflexible guitar and a fame sample about the imitation of life . The track it self is very delightful because the streched melodies. The man brake on 03:35 is show the emotional side of this track and make it deeper for short time, but all the chaos come back on 05:20.
  • 04.Neurotic Pulse – I'm feeling bizarre David Abergel aka Neurotic Pulse is a new project. Unfortunately, I did not connect to this track at all...I found it boring without any target, just kick, baseline and some melodies around...bizzare track .

  • 06.Ellis Vanghoul - Nerdlead Elad Emek is the next to come...one more new name for me. I think Elad is trying to push the comp to the danceable direction and he do it nice actually.   • 07.Mojo jojo vs Bubble - Time to kill This time Guy and Karen set together with Yoni Aharon in the studion and released to the world the result - "Time To Kill". I don't have much words to write about this track, but I'll definitely keep my eye on the next materials from Morning Dust project.
  • 10.Bubble - Hour of power Three and half minutes of freestlye from Bubble. This "track" is unnecessary if you ask me...just a female vocal repeating again and again with boring baseline...exhausting.

Hi All ! The familiar DJ Pena was compiled one more masterpeace for us with 8 groovy tracks with the necessary sophistication. On the compilation you can find "big" names like Perfect Stranger, Echotek , James Monro and more... "Daily Basis" was released on June 2006.

His unique style is something between proggy and full on and he know how to combine it perfectly for the dance floor. This groovy base line always make me move the head with big big smile...together with this effects around, this "forever night" sound like a magical journey. An excellent begining for this story...sexy music... .
  • 02.Behind Blue Eyes & Perfect Stranger - Diamond in the Rough (Perfect Stranger Edit) The original version of this track was released on Iboga's last comp ("Summer Collection vol 2"), and here Yuli is present his new edit for it. The track is more relaxing and deep with the PS special atmosphere. There is almost no stop on the track...always the developing beats with an emotionaly playings on the side. On 04:30 the track is down completly and give us an unforgatablle brake with pumping up and some sparks of positive energy all around. Goos work Yuli.
  • 03.James Monro - Psycho The honorable, Mr. Monro, is the next to come. I think it will be right to divide this track for 2 parts : The developing part (00:00-06:00) and the psycho part (06:00-until the end). The first part is a bit boring and stuck without any special element or move but thats all change after six minutes - than suddenly there is four minutes of madness and freestyle mind with unclear effects. This man is so supring and varied...
  • 04.Rob Mooney - Feelin Electro (Valentino Kanzyani rmx) Very nice electro tune...too much similar to the house genre in my opinion, but it can easily be a hit on the main-stream dance floors. A refreshing track for the summer time, which spread some good breeze around.
  • 05.Fusi & Johnson - Outside After the "noisy" track before, "Outside" is more deeper and groover. This is kind of tune which fit exactly for home-listening with a promised enjoyable . I like this tempo because it's always make you move slowly with a body shaking. Kind of electro-progressive track with a lot of vocals & samples around, and tons of good vibes everywhere.
  • 06.Lunaspice - Collectiv Energy A new project for me, but the music speak for it self. A proffesional progressive with a smart building, hypnotic atmosphere and great flow...the kick is fat and stretch like it should be and all this components fir together well. This track is more for the soul and less for the legs .
  • 07.True To Nature - Breeze Ten minutes of pure pleasure ! the story start with a delightful introduction and keep this stirring orientation all over the track. I'm recommend to the listener to close the eyes and let this beautiful tunes to get in to the brain...an unique experience for sure ! there is no necessity for definition here - just a good music...well done.
  • 08.Manuel Duego - Inside The Box The last track is come from a very talented young artist from Israel. This guy have an excellent proggy skills, and he know how to use the formula on the right way. A pushing progreesive track with fantastic atmosphere and brilliant melodies over. For me this is the best track on this special compilation. This track will take you to a rare trip of hallucinate vibes next to the pumping beats. PERFECT !! "Daily Basis" is a different compilation from Flow Records. Pena has pay more attention to the electro-house direction but did not forget the lovely progreesive music and this combination creates a 8 tracks story with touches from each genre. Get it original

Doros is influenced by the CC direction and here he is try to show some variation, and he do it very nice actually. The track is different that the first tracks, and not a bad one at all. I would like to hear more stuuf from this guy in the future.
  • 08.TOR.MA - ying vs yang My favorite track is the next one. Rafael Harnandez aka Tor.Ma is bring an enjoyable track without too much pressure or noise, just pure music on calm tempo. The melodies & vocals have important part here and thats why - "Ying vs Yang" track is so positive and happy.
  • 09.E-MANTRA - liquid frequency I guess we neede wait to the end for get the top music of this compilation. An excellent track by Emanuel Carpus with smart building and rare flow. "Liquid Frequency" is the most powerfull track here and for sure of the good ones I heard lately, everything is just sit well - the kick & the melodies and the whole atmosphere. I wish there are more tracks like this one in this cd. I really like this guy's work...keep it up ! Samples & orders

Hi All ! The multi talnated label - Mushy Records - is presents 3rd release. Violent Energy is the debut album of Elad Emek aka Ellis Van Ghoul. The last two releases of this label are forced me to pay attention for anything new, which come out by Mushy Records.
  • 01.Princess Guenavier 85 BPM Mr. Van Ghoul is starts his album with a soft symphony as an introduction for the whole album. Two and half minutes of pleasant playing, which give us a clue about the upcoming experience.
  • 02.Pussy Dancers 143-145 BPM It's weird...when the first kick entered, I thought this is an old material of Skazi from his legendary Animal album . This un-compromise style together with some melodies inside is make this track more happier and enjoyable. This is defintely not kind of tracks which make madness in the dance floor but, very nice opening for the album.
  • 03.Blood for my Vampire 150 BPM This track and generally the whole album has a scary atmosphere of darkness and evil. "Blood for my Vampire" is faster and more danceable, but still this is not kind of the music you remmember for long time.   • 04.Holy skys of Eden 150 BPM The tempo is still high. Now I finally find my self smile and move as I like to do - a beautifull melody on the begining together with fat kick & groovy baseline is the right formula for make people like me start dance. "Holy skys of Eden" has many up's and down's, but generally it's sound excellent.
  • 05.Violent Energy 145 BPM It's time for the title track. The track is starts with a mysterious melody which gets the support of the Skazi's kick & baseline like before. I really like the build here, but in my opinion the track is lost his self in the middle and the result is very complicated. The final brkae is make me move the legs a bit, but not more than that.
  • 06.Power is love. Love is a Dancefloor 148 BPM Before we start to analyze the music, I must say a good word about the name...cool one. The track is simply crazy tune...nothing is expected and the melodies just srtike again and again.
  • 07.Circus Psychedelius 145 BPM I'm sorry to say it, but I found this track very boring and un-danceable. Lets just say - this is noy my cup of tea at all...
  • 08.Father of all 145 BPM This track is make me curious...what is the sroty behind the music ? A lovely tune with smart building and perfect flow...this is what I called - unique full on...music from the soul with calm atmosphere and hidden vibe which exploding on the end...fascinating !!
  • 09.Flutaie 90 BPM "Flutaie" is kind of circle-closing together with the first track - "Princess Guenavier". A short playing with calm atmosphere and a chance of thinking a bit together with those amazing playings. **Bonus Track**
  • 10.Dreaming Japan (live recording) 150 BPM Be carefull please becasue "Dreaming Japan" track is going to lead you far away to a long journey of psychedelic and fun. Lets leave the definitions in the side...this is a pure music with emotions and deep feelings...way to go !!! All in all, as you read, this album has a good moments near some bad ones IMO. The regular full on tracks are pathetic and not special at all, BUT tracks like 8 & 10 make me leave the album with taste for more of this exactly kind of music.

Hi All ! Matan & Itay and Aviram were released a brand new album - Come Together. This album is presents their mature side near the side which don't want to grow up this album was released at their home label - Compact Records on September 06...now lets talk some music
  • 01.Sesto Dance 145 BPM The "Sesto Dance" is starts with a funky playing and a robotic vocal which creates an electricity atmosphere...and those happy melodies always make me smile. A full power full on track with a crazy ideas of this un-expected guys.
  • 02.Rollercoaster 146 BPM The drums introduction is let an impression of a serious and mysterious track but don't get it worng, "Rollercoaster" is a collect of fast beats together with some "noisey" melodies and some vocals for dessert....just go with da flow...

  • 04.Perfect Day 145 BPM "Perfect Day" is defintely one of the top tracks in this album - a fascinating begining (which remind me a bit their old tune - Blue Leprachun) with a fat & groovy kick right after and a perfect vibe...even closer to the proggy side (the good side ). Apocalypse) 145 BPM I had a big expections from this track because I loves almost every material of Mr. Apocalypse, but tell you the truth, in my opinion "Trance in Motion" is not more than exhausting track, which the only question I asked during it is - when it's finish already ?. The only positive thing I found here is the nice brake on 05:00 with a developing melody with a kick which become stornger, but few seconds later everything back to normal .

This one is definitely not recommned for people with weak hearts .
  • 09.Pumpkin 147 BPM I did not so connect to all those mixing melodies which try to heard as a "psychedelic melodies", just the opposite - it's sound childish and un-mature but this is just my opinion. This is the sweetest ending I remmember for a full on album. 8 minutes of pure pleasure (I even don't want mention the final 2 minutes...so un-proffsional and unnecessary). So people if you also want "come together" to this trip, just click here

V-Tunes : Variable · Ear Peaks Music @ October 06

V-Tunes : Variable

Date of Inscription Oct 9, 2006 13:46
Replies
Views 3,272
IsraTranceDiscogs
Hi All ! V-Tunes project is releases a new album - "Variable". Behind this project, there are 2 talneted brains - Sandro Kulka & Hans Muester from Switzerland. " Variable " is a down tempo progressive album (127-136 BPM) with classic slices of groovy moments. This album was released in Ear Peaks Music on 6th October.
  • 01.Kick It 136 BPM The first track is also the fastest track on the album. Together with Simon Weber aka Silent Sphere, the V-Tunes guys present a fresh proggy bomb with a summer atmosphere and fat groove in. "Kick It" is actually the hit of the album - Nadi & Huda G are keep play this tune time after time and always make a serious madness in the dance floor. It is built well with cheezy melodies and perfect baseline, which creates an unique vibe of proggy-diging. The brake on 05:00 is located in my head for long time because the unforgettable up few second later. To sum it up on two words - Stormer track !!
  • 02.In The Hights (V-Tunes Rmx) 134 BPM This track was originaly written by Kooler and here is the re-mix version for it. "In The Hights" is calmer, if you compare it to "Kick It", but this is definitely not a track to pass away. The baseline is slow, the kick is rolling and the atmosphere is positive. The brake on 04:30, with the soft melodies and the male vocal, is the highlight moment in the whole track, which keep up and up all the time. Great work guys !!!
  • 03.Progression (Album Version) 134 BPM "Progression" was released before on Huda's compilation - "G Spot", and now it's sound different a bit after some changes and additions. This is what I like to name as a massive & heavy tune. On home listening, I can't imagine this track kick the dance floor, but trust me people - this is a dance floor groover ! the first three minutes are build from fat kick and chilling melody together, and progressively it's developing to new levels of groove & shaking. Mature progressive tune.
  • 04.Simple, Dirty and Side Chained 132 BPM It's time to put some variation and thats exactly what this track is bring with it. A funky-clubby tune with a promised enjoyable. During the track - there are some moments which I found my self move the body on a sexy way with big big smile on the face. The only problem I have with this track is that I think it's too long, minute or two less would be sound better IMHO.
  • 05.No One Forever 134 BPM The factor which made me fall in love with the progressive style is the reapting loops, which always back with new effect, melody, vocal, guitar or something else and thats why the track is resumed all the time. "No One Forever" is a great example for what I just wrote - the baseline & kick are always at the same structure, but everytime "they" come back with new motive - a female singing and a symphonic melody this time. This is really an excellent choice to flow with.
  • 06.Tripple Experiment 132 BPM Everyone - please stand where you are and show us your weridest dance on the background of "Tripple Experiment" tune . 8 minutes and 26 seconds of unexpected movements, full of uplifting playings and mysterious atmosphere of Sherlok Holmes detective story .
  • 07.Stupid Brain 127 BPM Despite the lowest Bpm, "Stupid Brain" is one of the most danceable track in the album. It's include many funky moments by hallucinate brains (not stupid, hallucinate ) and a delightful vibe of freedom and happiness. Smile here, smile there - the smiles on everywhere !
  • 08.Quadrad 130 BPM After all the happy & positive vibe before - "Quadrad" track is presents a deep atmosphere near some heavy beats and shady resonances. I like to listen this track when I'm alone, because it's has the secret magic to take out all the thoughts from the head and think about them. An addictive track in my opinion.
  • 09.Funky Angel 130 BPM What ?! we are already in the end ?! now I need to leave the variable planet of Sandro and Hans. "Funky Angel" is a very good option for lay the head on the pillow and let the little effects play with the brain and lead him to safe place of silence and relaxation. Those female vocals just add to the special feeling of this track. All of this together force us to end the trek and back to the reality. "Variable" album is for sure one more successful release from the Ear Peaks Music group, which gives the progressive genre another push up. One more feedback is to the designer of this cd - all the concept of the album is gentle and pleasent. Well Done !!! Now, after the hard work of Sandro & Hans for bring us such a high quality album, it's our time to pay them back by purchase their album

Various — Reflection

Date of Inscription Oct 29, 2006 13:48
Replies
Views 1,199
IsraTranceDiscogs
Hi All ! Blue Tunes Records is a new progressive label from Germany, which seems to be a top quality label with tons of excellent releases. Untill now, this label released just two cd's and the "Reflection" compilation is the third release so far. The man who selected the 8 tracks for compile this cd is B52 from Switzerland. The style is an European progressive on the highest levels of proffesional.
  • 01.BBE - Excerpts from dreams(SCS rmx) What is more classic to open comp, other than a remix for proggy-hit... Sun Control Species was took the best track from Behind Blue Eyes album and re-mix it. The two versions are completly different - this one is more happier and groovier with great flow and comfortable vibes. The melodies of the original version are put an additional value to the whole aspect of this track. Good work !
  • 02.Ski Fi - Doors of perception WOW ! what is cooking here...delicious ! Almost one minute of calm introduction of symphony and waves, but the kick is stormer. A well build track with gradually power-up and lovely atmosphere all the way. On 03:30 the brake is full of sexy female vocals and following up just kick the listener higher.
  • 03.Cafu - Space navigator Cafu from Switzerland is the next to come. He is going to release his album on Plusquam Records and this track just help you understand what you should look for. An enjoyable tune with unique vibe and fatty kick near a slowly baseline. "Space Navigator" is a down tempo track, which put a soul for this comilation and some emotions too...going deeper.
  • 04.Symphonix vs Xibalba - We find a way (Earsugar RMX) One more remix...Capo and DJ Martin they are the minds behind the Earsugar project. I can identify the happy style of Nicola as Liquid Soul together with the intransigent style of Martin. I'm actually don't know the original version of the track, but the new version is very nice and melodic.
  • 05.Dualsnug - John lego The fifth track is no other than a dance-floor groover ! a pumping baseline with powerfull kick...actually like a slowly full on (on the positive way) . I'm sure this new artist will be a big star soon, if he will keep produce this kind of music...it's very intersting to know what they eat & drink there in Switzerland, which the results are so groovy .
  • 06.Jey & Ex - Vodka & Cola Let's check what is going on with the progressive genre in Mexico...if I need to judge by this track, so the situation there is very good . "Vodka & Cola" is a track to fly with to the sky...the melodies are so soft and the atmosphere is the most convenient as it can be. Way to go !
  • 07.Paste - Down on the streets(Symphonix rmx) After few great materials of some new projects, it's time to hear something from an experienced & veteran project as Symphonix. This remix is so proffesional and sharp from every aspect you look - sound, groove, building, power... Definitely one of the best tracks of this compilation..."this is true"....
  • 08.Nasser - Free days Nasser is closing the Reflection comp. with a progressive-house track. An excellent choice for an ending track - calm, special and fascinating... "Free Days" is very recommended for home-listening with promised enjoyment...the melodies on the middle are so sweet...delightfull tune.

IsraTranceDiscogsSpotify
Hi All ! Bubble dou just released their second album. Guy Sarnat and Karen Bagdasarov are present upgrading style with many influences and varied directions of creation. The album called "Sound Of Silence" and out on Mushy Records (fourth release - keep it up guys) at November 2006.
  • 01.Divine The album is starts with cheezy introduction of exciting male singing and some soft guitars background. "Divine" is kind of enjoyable complex full of groovy beats and gentle atmosphere. This track is shows the concept of the whole album with tons of brilliant ideas inside. The singing from the begining of the track is comes back later and became longer now.
  • 02.Sound of silence The title track is here already. "Sound of silence" is more deeper and has bigger effect in the dance floor on compare to the first track. This one is includes a lot of games with the baseline and kick, thats why the listener never get bored . Guy & Karen are deserve for one more good word for the beautiful melody here - hypnotize !!!
  • 03.We're gonna b cool This track has intro of ambient track but the tempo is going high continuance. I can't say we have here something unique and special because it's sound the same all over the track - same ideas & games...I'm disappointed from this one.
  • 04.Elect-On The Bubble's lovely playings are always impress me. The first melody here is turns the track to pleasant area. "Elect-On" is fitting well to the noon time for get calm and relax with some soft beats.
  • 05.Loose Control All the singers of you - please turn on your microphone and join to "Loose Control" song . I guess the Bubble guys like the singing addition and feel comfortable to put it again and again. The track it self is definitely not one of the highlight moments on this album...I found it kind of annoing. The only thing I somehow liked here is the colorful guitars during the tune.
  • 06.Star Wars Despite the repulsive vocals, "Star Wars" is very good track IMO. It is a pounding tune with amazing melodic touch (sometimes it's remind me the old Yahel's music) and strong ups, which has the powers for serious dance floor madness.
  • 07.I'm Looking (Unique vs Rewind evolution rmx) For all the fans of the old Bubble's style - this one is for you. It's has some parts of boring, but the moments like the one on 02:15 just forces me to fall in love with this tune. This is alomst impossible to hear full Bubble track without some vocal or sample and after five minutes it's happening here also .
  • 08.La Revolcion A typical Bubble track - fat kick, groovy baseline, many games and remarkable melodies. This one is focusing on the psytrance side and less with the commerical aspect.
  • 09.Eve Electro Finally I found intersting track from the first second till the last one. A delightful tune with amazing vibes and freedom feeling. The main brake with the piano is so nice & sensitive and the up later is make me get up and actually dance to Bubble sounds...excellent work !!!
  • 10.Ambivalent Frequency I'm expected for high quality amabient for close the album, but the reality is different - the tempo is not going down. "Ambivalent Frequency" is one more full on track without something new, just the same formula. To sum it up, "Airless" (the debut Bubble's album) is better than "Sound Of Silence". I think that most of this album is not connect much to the psytrance category, however it's has an enjoyable music in...suitable for home-listening.
